page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
In the Domesday Book{Thirn}was called 'Thirne'. Thirn is a linear village, many houses of which are old .It has a Methodist Chapel which once was a house.There is also an Inn called the "Boot and Shoe".
{Clifton}was mentioned in the Domesday Book.Clifton was owned by King Cnut.There was then a castle but now in its place there is a house but it is still called Clifton Castle.You can not call Clifton a village.It is really an estate.
{Low Ellington}is a hamlet surrounding a central area which is very overgrown,rather marshy ,rough grazing land.The people use their goats to eat down this marshy green.
